questionsData.title: . Ingredients are things that are used in cooking
. A volcano is a valley with a hole in the top
. Frequency of sound is measured in decibels (dB)
questionsData.explain_answer:
Frequency is measured in hertz (Hz) -
the number of waves per second.

questionsData.title: . A smooth surface reflects less light than a rough surface
questionsData.explain_answer:
. A smooth surface reflects more light than a rough surface

  • Smoothness and Light Interaction: When light hits a smooth surface, the light waves travel in a parallel fashion and are reflected in a predictable direction. This is called specular reflection. Imagine bouncing a ball on a flat, polished floor - it bounces back in a straight line.

  • Roughness and Light Scattering: On a rough surface, the light waves encounter many tiny bumps and imperfections. These imperfections cause the light waves to scatter in many different directions. This is called diffuse reflection. Think of bouncing a ball on a bed of pebbles - it bounces back in many unpredictable directions.

? Where were brown and green colors seen
questionsData.article: Early humans watched their fires blacken the ceilings of the caves where they lived. They saw blue ,and red in the sky and brown and green on the ground. In time people began to understand that color not only made the world more beautiful, it was also able to convey emotions and symbolize power. Using colors they extracted from insects, plants and minerals, primitive humans copied animals , painting their bodies to signal aggression toward an enemy or to attract a mate. Over the centuries, the source of colors such as blue, purple, and red were carefully guarded and were often worth as much as gold. In the 19 ͭ ͪ century a young chemistry student became the first to manufacture a synthetic dye and suddenly the world become a much more colorful place. By the 20 ͭ ͪ century , as scientists discovered the psychological effects of colors, everyone from advertisers to educators found ways to make use of color to influence our feelings and behavior.

Electricity is used to lift the lift .the underlined word is a/an ..........
questionsData.explain_answer:
• The first "lift" acts as the verb describing the action - electricity is used to lift something.
  • The second "lift" refers to the object being lifted. It identifies what's being raised - the lift itself.

questionsData.title: . The world …… a pandemic last year
…… Ahmed broke the vase
? How ….. milk do you want
. Here is the institute …… I study at
questionsData.explain_answer:
. Here is the institute which I study at

"Which" is often used when you're choosing from a limited set of options. In your sentence, you're simply stating the location,.

questionsData.title: . Nezar ….. two days ago
. She must be grateful …… your help
. Of the following words, only ……. a compound
..…. She drives
. Have the cows ….. in the farm
questionsData.explain_answer:
Use of have/get + infinitive

You use these verbs to replace other instruction words such as ask, tell or order.

Example:

Ask the boy to put away his bag.
→    Have the boy put away his bag.
→    Get the boy to put away his bag.
Note: With have, the infinitive is without to.
